Forsey","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/private.jpg?width=639&name=private.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn5@2020_2/2020-07-30/1596118307232_db7e7e313b73ae29.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/how-grow-instagram-followers-2.jpg?width=466&name=how-grow-instagram-followers-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn41@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596118304955_95dc5ed23cd40675.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/how-gain-instagram-followers-2.jpg?width=466&name=how-gain-instagram-followers-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn53@2020_3/2020-07-30/1596118309327_465ee3c5afddef23.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/gain-followers-instagram.jpg?width=466&name=gain-followers-instagram.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn53@2020_1/2020-07-30/1596118312039_1f98a22c5750d61a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/gain-instagram-followers.jpg?width=466&name=gain-instagram-followers.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn37@2020_1/2020-07-30/1596118307432_452e4758e7ac231d.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram-followers-grow.jpg?width=466&name=instagram-followers-grow.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn33@2020_1/2020-07-30/1596118310875_fe022c2ade51c1a6.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram-grow-followers-2.jpg?width=466&name=instagram-grow-followers-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn49@2020_2/2020-07-30/1596118311247_c1a8b9b3cd5af6ba.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram-followers-1.jpg?width=466&name=instagram-followers-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn85@2020_3/2020-07-30/1596118306279_43657d0c622b356a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/followers-instagram-gain-more.jpg?width=466&name=followers-instagram-gain-more.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn13@2020_3/2020-07-30/1596118313404_9c83a724f3ee4d22.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagramicon.jpg?width=544&name=instagramicon.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn57@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596118304826_d85d60262b671a2b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/insta-followers-grow.jpg?width=466&name=insta-followers-grow.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn2@2020_4/2020-07-30/1596118309920_c5287bb205a6c0c8.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram-gain-more-followers.jpg?width=466&name=instagram-gain-more-followers.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn77@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596118311265_51b4ed917ddc8247.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fgain-instagram-followers&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn90@2020_1/2020-07-30/1596118310665_09489e6b5c3b66ff.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-07-30 22:11:40","updatedTime":"2020-07-30 14:11:40","title":"6 Tips for Creating Content That Spreads Naturally","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33906/6-tips-for-creating-content-that-spreads-naturally.aspx","description":"<div class=\"hs-migrated-cms-post\"> \n <p>We’ve all been there — you hit publish on a blog post and expect the social shares, page views, and agreeable comments to start rolling in. But sometimes you get pure silence (or crickets 🦗) in response.</p>  \n <p>Using social media and content to market your business isn't a new concept, so doing the bare minimum won't cut it.</p> \n <p>Don't believe me? Think about how often content is shared across the web — for instance, there are <a href=\"https://blog.hootsuite.com/facebook-demographics/\">over 2.45 billion Facebook users</a> and <a href=\"https://www.dsayce.com/social-media/tweets-day/\">over 500 million Tweets shared per day</a> on Twitter — and that's only two of the several popular social platforms. Needless to say, there's a lot of content <span style=\"font-style: italic;\">everywhere</span>&nbsp;... and as a result, a ton of noise.</p> \n <p>It takes more than simply publishing content to stand out among your target audience and competitors. To prepare you for success from the get-go, here are six ways to cut through all of that noise and make sure your content comes out on top every time — no additional marketing effort required.</p> \n <p style=\"font-size: 15px; text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Content%20Spread-1.png?width=1500&amp;name=Content%20Spread-1.png\" alt=\"create content that spreads\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n <p style=\"font-size: 18px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=More%20on%20@HubSpot’s%20blog%20post%20here:%20https://bit.ly/6content%20pic.twitter.com/h9JNTUPJKA\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><em>Share this image on Twitter!</em></span></a></p> \n <h2><strong>6 Ways to Create Content That Markets Itself</strong></h2> \n <p>Follow these tips to ensure your business's content stands out, spreads naturally, and markets itself among your target audience, buyer personas, leads, and customers.</p> \n <h4><strong>1)</strong> <strong>Don't try something new.</strong></h4> \n <p>Wait. What?</p> \n <p>Seriously. There's no reason you'd need to start from scratch with a completely new content approach every time you create blog.</p> \n <p>You already have content that's getting discovered on its own — so, learn from those efforts. (Remember, sometimes you can simply work smarter rather than harder.)</p> \n <p>Review your analytics and look for the posts that are generating the most views, shares, and leads, to determine how you can replicate that success.</p> \n <p>For instance, use <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/reports/analyze-your-landing-page-website-page-and-blog-performance\">web analytics</a> to identify your blog's sweet spots. From there, create a blog <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/business-blog-editorial-calendar-templates\">editorial calendar</a> with topics that will help you replicate past successes — whether it's a post's format, subject matter, title, author, or something else entirely.</p> \n <h4><strong>2) Surprise people.</strong></h4> \n <p>… Or make them happy, sad, afraid, angry, even disgusted!</p> \n <p>Why? Because, <strong>in content, there's a strong relationship between virality and emotion.</strong></p> \n <p>While I'm sure disgust or anger aren't really the kinds of reactions you want associated with your brand, that's not exactly the point here. The lesson is that content will be able to market itself if it provokes a strong emotional reaction with the audience. After they consume your content, they'll feel like they <em>have</em> to share it with others so they have the opportunity to feel the same emotion.</p> \n <p>Consider content you've read or created that provoked an emotion and action in the past — use this as inspiration for <em>your</em> content.</p> \n <h4><strong>3) Nail your headline.<br></strong></h4> \n <p>How can you increase the <span>likelihood</span> someone will click on a link to open your content?</p> \n <p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/types-of-blog-headlines\">A great headline</a> that's attention-grabbing and intriguing. No matter the subject of your content, a great headline will help a piece of content get opened more and spread further.</p> \n <p>So ... what makes a great headline? It's similar to writing a great subject line for email marketing. Think about these <a href=\"http://www.copyblogger.com/email-subject-lines/\">four U's</a> in regards to your subject lines and headlines:</p> \n <ul> \n  <li><strong>Useful:</strong> Why is the blog post valuable?</li> \n  <li><strong>Ultra-specific:</strong> What can I expect to learn from the blog post?</li> \n  <li><strong>Unique:</strong> Why is this blog post compelling and unique?</li> \n  <li><strong>Urgent:</strong> Why should I read this <em>now</em>?</li> \n </ul> \n <p>Be sure to incorporate all four of these qualities in every headline that you write so your audience will want to open and share your content.</p> \n <h4><strong>4) Show don't tell.</strong></h4> \n <p>Today's <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/visual-content-marketing-strategy\">social media platforms reward visual content</a> — this should be a major element of your content strategy. After all, visuals are proven to increase shares and engagement.</p> \n <p>Whether it's unique photos, graphic design content, video content, or branding visuals you share via blog, site page, email, social media, etc., they will help you increase conversions while offering an engaging and appealing presentation of your content.</p> \n <p><span>Not to mention, these days you don't need to be a designer to create and share professional-looking visuals. In fact, there are plenty of easy-to-use <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/free-visual-content-tools-list\">design tools</a></span><span> on the market for people with any level of design knowledge.<br></span></p> \n <h4><strong>5) Enable your blog to market your content.</strong></h4> \n <p>More social media <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-increase-referral-traffic-and-get-more-leads\">referral traffic</a> coming to your site means more new visitors arriving via that content for the very first time.</p> \n <p>However, these new visitors likely don't know much about your business — meaning, you need to capture their interest and gain their trust before they're ready to become evangelists of your content, too.</p> \n <p>Consider how you can use your blog's real estate to improve the presentation of your content and offer further recommendations that will earn new visitors' attention and loyalty.</p> \n <p>For example, add related-content recommendations at the bottom of every post. By tailoring recommendations to audience members, you'll increase page views, time-on-site, and engagement.</p> \n <p>This is what the \"Related Articles\" section at the bottom of HubSpot's Blog posts look like:</p> \n <p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-20%20at%204.31.14%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-20%20at%204.31.14%20PM.png\" alt=\"related blog articles example\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n <p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-creation\"><em><span style=\"font-size: 13px;\">Source</span></em></a></p> \n <p>In addition to recommendation widgets, add <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/29544/the-ultimate-cheat-sheet-for-creating-social-media-buttons.aspx\">social follow and sharing buttons and modules</a> to your content. This allows your audience members to click a button, no matter where they're consuming your content, and immediately share that content among their personal networks.</p> \n <p>Making this process simple is critical to your content spreading.&nbsp;I mean, have you every tried to Tweet an article that didn't have a <em>Tweet</em> button?</p> \n <p>It's a total pain: 1) copy a URL, 2) open another tab, 3) go to a link shortener, 4) paste that link, 5) click the shorten button, 6) copy that link, 7) go to their Twitter account, 8) paste that link in there, 9) look up the Twitter handle of the publisher, 10) and then add custom copy for the tweet.</p> \n <p>I'm exhausted just typing it out. So, make life easier on your audience and, in return, <em>they'll</em> do a lot of your content marketing for you.</p> \n <p>Finally, make sure you're making content subscription easy. For example, your blog should have a <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/ctas/create-calls-to-action-ctas\">customized CTA</a> so people can choose to \"Subscribe\" and receive email alerts when you publish new content.</p> \n <p>What better way to drive email traffic to your content without lifting a finger (except for the finger you use to press \"Publish\", of course) than growing a giant base of followers and subscribers?</p> \n <h4><strong>6) Don't forget about search engine optimization (SEO).</strong></h4> \n <p>Every time you publish a blog post, you create a new page on your site that's being indexed in the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/serp\">search engine results page (SERP)</a>. At that point, <em>Google </em>is marketing content for you. For free. Forever.</p> \n <p>If you pay attention to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-search-engine-optimization\">SEO</a>,&nbsp;hone in on&nbsp;<a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-rank-hubspot-seo-strategist\">keyword research</a>, and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-seo-modern-marketer-optimize-your-posts-ht\">optimize your content</a>, and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/historical-blog-seo-conversion-optimization\">update your current content</a>, it'll surface more frequently SERPs and you'll drastically improve your traffic, conversions, brand awareness, and more.</p> \n <p><span style=\"font-style: italic;\">Editor's note: This post was originally published in December, 2012 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</span></p> \n <span style=\"font-style: italic;\"> </span>\n <span class=\"hs-cta-wrapper\"> <span class=\"hs-cta-node hs-cta-bdc85ae5-d952-41ee-9cf4-8ff3ec62723e\"><span style=\"font-style: italic;\">  </span><a href=\"http://cta-redirect.hubspot.com/cta/redirect/53/bdc85ae5-d952-41ee-9cf4-8ff3ec62723e\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/bdc85ae5-d952-41ee-9cf4-8ff3ec62723e.png\"></a> </span>  </span>    \n <span class=\"hs-cta-wrapper\"> <span class=\"hs-cta-node \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 28 Jul 2020 11:45:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/create%20content%20that%20spreads%20naturally.jpg#keepProtocol","linkMd5":"0b4d82e129cbe5a10a7c50dd908cc3ba","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn41@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596118303675_139d47f56ceb8772.webp","metaImg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/create%20content%20that%20spreads%20naturally.jpg#keepProtocol","author":"Janet Aronica","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Content%20Spread-1.png?width=1500&name=Content%20Spread-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn65@2020_4/2020-07-30/1596118311399_bb40dda5cae0a9cf.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-20%20at%204.31.14%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-20%20at%204.31.14%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn50@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596118310377_11ac57bd2b7faf8c.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/bdc85ae5-d952-41ee-9cf4-8ff3ec62723e.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn13@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596118307080_a7610b2e2c9ab35b.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/249/2891588d-22d3-4b0b-8db4-27a7a57f6c45.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn41@2020_4/2020-07-30/1596118308641_2caecb78af1abfb0.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fblog%2Ftabid%2F6307%2Fbid%2F33906%2F6-tips-for-creating-content-that-spreads-naturally.aspx&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn53@2020_1/2020-07-30/1596118305952_c772dae6d69c28ff.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-07-30 22:11:40","updatedTime":"2020-07-30 14:11:40","title":"Working Remotely? Try These 35 Tools for Better Communication, Collaboration & Organization","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/remote-work-tools","description":"<p>Today, you and your team are expected to perform at the same level no matter where you're working from.</p>  \n<p>With the help of internet connection, it's relatively easy for us to get most our daily work done, whether it's related to publishing a blog post, sending a follow-up email, conducting a video call with a team member of prospect, or setting up a workflow to nurture prospects and customers in your CRM.</p> \n<p>But, when it comes to remote work, we all know internet connection doesn't solve <em>everything</em> .</p> \n<p>Tasks and obstacles are bound to arise that are challenging to manage remotely — when it comes to these complex tasks and cross-team collaboration, communication and productivity can get messy.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>As the need for remote work has grown, many companies have discovered and started implementing tools and resources that enable employees to be as productive as possible while working from home.</p> \n<p>To help determine which tools are ideal for your remote team, we've compiled a list of some of the best tools for you to use:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"#for-general-collaboration\">Tools For General Collaboration</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"#for-task-and-project-management\">Tools For Task and Project Management</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"#for-scheduling-and-hosting-virtual-meetings\">Tools For Scheduling and Hosting Virtual Meetings</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"#for-asset-management\">Tools For Asset Management</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"#for-announcements-and-internal-documentation\">Tools For Announcements and Internal Documentation</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"#for-tracking-team-progress\">Tools For Tracking Team Progress</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"#for-team-decision-making\">Tools For Team Decision-Making</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2>35 Helpful Remote Work Tools and Software</h2> \n<p>The following 35 remote work tools are segmented by use case to help you determine the type of resource you and your team would benefit most from.</p> \n<p>Let's get started.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Remote Work Tools For General Collaboration</h3> \n<h4>1. Google Suite</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Hiy2bRgPnktaffLfd0byS_FQmh5O-hBs-kJEToYaG9xju-Km5twRb1LRqyEHutE03hMeT8vpvuI9r2ap22T8umteKVks0oRtt0Oe=w2200\" alt=\"G Suite products for remote or dispersed teams\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 12px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://gsuite.google.com/\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><a href=\"https://gsuite.google.com/\">Google Suite (G Suite) </a> is a budget-friendly Google platform that allows your teams to collaborate on Google Docs, Google Sheets, and Google Slide, among other easy-to-use Google Drive tools. You can also share a team calendar and create work emails through the G Suite.</p> \n<h4>2. Microsoft Office Teams</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-03-26%20at%2010.28.13%20AM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-03-26%20at%2010.28.13%20AM.png\" alt=\"Microsoft Office Teams\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://products.office.com/en-US/microsoft-teams/free\" style=\"font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>While G Suite can be used entirely online within one platform, <a href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/group-chat-software?&amp;ef_id=EAIaIQobChMIpPm0jPmX6AIV1iCtBh3urQkSEAAYASAAEgIXN_D_BwE:G:s&amp;OCID=AID2000955_SEM_EAIaIQobChMIpPm0jPmX6AIV1iCtBh3urQkSEAAYASAAEgIXN_D_BwE:G:s&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMIpPm0jPmX6AIV1iCtBh3urQkSEAAYASAAEgIXN_D_BwE\">Microsoft Office Teams</a> allows you to download apps like Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint to your computer or mobile device. Like G Suite, you also can use this general suite of tools to manage, share, store, and edit documents in team folders.</p> \n<p>Aside from the more specific apps, Microsoft Teams also allows you to communicate with your teammates via video calls, email, and through an internal discussion platform where your colleagues can create posts or ask questions.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Remote Work Tools For Task and Project Management</h3> \n<h4>3. Trello</h4> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 1500px; max-height: 844px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.27%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/xky48zyL9iA\" width=\"1500\" height=\"844\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p><a href=\"https://trello.com/\">Trello</a> allows you to create a dashboard that highlights large projects or categories and tasks related to them. Each small task, called a \"card\" can be labeled with a colored tag and text.</p> \n<p>For example, if you want to say something is \"Urgent\" you could create a red card tag that says \"Urgent\" on it and stick it to the appropriate Trello cards. You can also assign cards and deadlines to members of your team and track each card's progress through its Activity area.</p> \n<h4>4. Asana</h4> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 1500px; max-height: 844px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.27%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/IMAFWVLGFyw\" width=\"1500\" height=\"844\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p><a href=\"https://asana.com/product\">Asana</a> lets you create and delegate tasks, organize, and check off tasks into shared projects, chat within each task so conversations stay organized, and add attachments from your computer, Dropbox, Box, and Google Drive.</p> \n<p>It also has calendar features, dashboards for projects, and your very own to-do list.</p> \n<h4>5. Assembla</h4> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 1500px; max-height: 844px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.27%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/a2JteGLzLzU\" width=\"1500\" height=\"844\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Project management for web developers seems to be <a href=\"https://www.assembla.com/content/index2-4.php\">Assembla's</a> niche, though it could handle project management for just about any type of freelancing.</p> \n<p>It tracks tickets and time, produces reports, and simplifies product releases and bug-fixing — plus many say it's easier to set up than Jira.</p> \n<h4>6. Basecamp</h4> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 1500px; max-height: 844px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.27%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/WUzaUGlSkQs\" width=\"1500\" height=\"844\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p><a href=\"https://basecamp.com/\">Basecamp</a> is a simple and easy-to-use <a href=\"https://youteam.io/blog/project-management-tools-for-remote-teams/\">project management software</a> that helps you arrange your calendars, set meeting schedules, track assignments, and store documents.</p> \n<p>All of your project management occurs on one organized dashboard to give you a digestible birds-eye-view of everything that's happening.</p> \n<h4>7. RingCentral and Glip</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image-3847.png?width=1500&amp;name=image-3847.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"Glip RingCentral project management and communication app\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://glip.com/\" style=\"font-style: italic; font-weight: normal;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>There's another great tool by <a href=\"https://glip.com/\">Ring Central and Glip</a>. While <a href=\"https://www.ringcentral.com/dm.html?BMID=GG17ED888610&amp;cid=sem&amp;mkwid=sHjNKSypM|pcrid|325303833020|pkw|ringcentral|pmt|e|pdv|c|slid||&amp;pgrid=41091333769&amp;ptaid=kwd-353845338&amp;st-t=&amp;RCKW=ringcentral&amp;RCMT=e&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMIpu2g0_-X6AIVAR-tBh38pQiOEAAYASAAEgKxF_D_BwE#ring-1\">RingCentral</a> enables company calls to your business line to be forwarded to a mobile phone when you're working remotely, Glip helps you manage basic project management and text-based team communication.</p> \n<p>For task management, shared calendars, file sharing, annotating images, and real-time group chat, Glip is a strong tool. It also helps ensure all those chats are fully searchable.</p> \n<p>Along with group chats and standard project management features, you can activate video chats on the Glip app which allows you to talk to your teammates about ongoing tasks.</p> \n<h4>8. Github</h4> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 1500px; max-height: 844px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.27%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/ZwHWPyy7qbI\" width=\"1500\" height=\"844\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Web developers will love <a href=\"https://github.com/\">GitHub</a> because it's designed to build software with remote teams. The platform allows teams to virtual participate in code review and the management of both open source and private projects.</p> \n<p>The GitHub Marketplace offers coders a variety of tools that can help them do their jobs more efficiently, regardless of where they log in.</p> \n<h4>9. Jira</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-07-28%20at%204.21.43%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-07-28%20at%204.21.43%20PM.png\" alt=\"best remote tools jira\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"><a href=\"https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"></a></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira\">Jira</a> is another project management tool primarily for developers, customer support, and IT reps that allows you to assign and track work as well as issues that need to be solved.</p> \n<p>It also has a handy mobile and desktop interface for project management on the go.</p> \n<h4>10. Podio</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image-3848.png?width=1500&amp;name=image-3848.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"Podio project management platform for teams\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://podio.com/site/en\" style=\"font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>Part project manager, part Facebook for companies, you can use <a href=\"https://podio.com/site?gclid=CIey29fW2MQCFRSPfgod8EEAwA\">Podio</a> to keep track of what you need to do, and chat while doing it.</p> \n<p>With the mobile app and website, you can create \"workspaces\" for different aspects of your work or projects. These workspaces look similar to a Facebook page as colleagues can comment or share information on them similarly to how they would share a Facebook post.</p> \n<p>You can also use the platform to communicate with teammates or manage client contacts privately since it has a wide range of privacy settings.</p> \n<h4>11. Taskworld</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://www.taskworld.com/assets/images/2a580e88bf04cf6f9cd0024917407ecb.png\" alt=\"Time tracking feature creating a time log for a task in Taskworld\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.taskworld.com/product/\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p>The sweet spot for <a href=\"https://www.taskworld.com/\">Taskworld</a> is managing projects and keeping track of tasks and subtasks.</p> \n<p>Its evaluation feature lets you measure and give feedback on job performance, setting it apart from other similar project management programs.</p> \n<h4>12. Monday.com</h4> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 1500px; max-height: 844px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.27%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/ObkWrfukomA\" width=\"1500\" height=\"844\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p><a href=\"http://monday.com\">Monday.com</a> is a web task management platform specifically for businesses and agencies. It offers similar features to Asana and Trello in that you can watch the progress of tasks on a dashboard and assign projects to team members.</p> \n<p>But, additionally, it also allows marketing teams to plan tasks with their budget in mind.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Remote Work Tools For Scheduling and Hosting Virtual Meetings</h3> \n<h4>13. Zoom</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image-3849.png?width=1500&amp;name=image-3849.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"Zoom meeting on mobile and desktop device\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://zoom.us/meetings\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p><a href=\"http://zoom.us\">Zoom</a> is an easy-to-use desktop platform and app that allows you to schedule, launch, and record virtual meetings with your team. These meetings can be entered remotely from a computer, smartphone, or voice via a dial in phone.</p> \n<p>During Zoom meetings, you can also share your screen with teammates so they can see your work or presentations.</p> \n<h4>14. GoToMeeting</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://www.gotomeeting.com/-/media/project/images/g2m/img-sem-hero-min-b-png.png?h=603&amp;w=1044&amp;la=en-US&amp;hash=34DB9619B933D1162C9DF55DA2495FC5\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"GoToMeeting Group meeting on desktop and smartphone app\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.gotomeeting.com/lp/sem?cid=g2m_noam_ggs_cpc_71700000060694846_58700005493369263_p50143970146&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMIt_jawIuY6AIVUT0MCh3MwwMJEAAYASAAEgIiofD_BwE&amp;gclsrc=aw.ds\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><a href=\"http://www.gotomeeting.com/\">GoToMeeting</a> allows you to schedule and launch virtual meetings or webinars where users can log in or call to hear only hosts speak.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">These meetings can be recorded and sent to participants after they're completed.</p> \n<h4>15. Google Hangouts</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.05.43%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.05.43%20PM.png\" alt=\"google hangouts remote work tool\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://hangouts.google.com/\" style=\"font-style: italic; font-weight: normal;\">Source</a></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://hangouts.google.com/\">Google Hangouts</a> is a popular option because Google is usually convenient for those who use Google Calendar to manage your schedule and GMail for emails.</p> \n<h4>16. Join.me</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.07.13%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.07.13%20PM.png\" alt=\"join.me remote work tool\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.join.me/?BoxUrl=https://secure.join.me/BigIdea/ShareJoin/Pages/ShareJoin.aspx&amp;ReturnUrl=https://secure.join.me/federated/loginsso.aspx&amp;TrackingUniqueId=208C8B7E-ED65-4A97-8615-4EAEE6457DE9\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><a href=\"https://www.join.me/?BoxUrl=https://secure.join.me/BigIdea/ShareJoin/Pages/ShareJoin.aspx&amp;ReturnUrl=https://secure.join.me/federated/loginsso.aspx&amp;TrackingUniqueId=208C8B7E-ED65-4A97-8615-4EAEE6457DE9\">Join.me</a> is great for fast and easy screen-share meetings.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">In addition to being able to schedule and launch quick virtual meetings with screen-share, you can also create a shareable URL to your own personal meeting room that people can log on to when they'd like to meet with you.<br><br></p> \n<h4>17. Skype</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.08.24%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.08.24%20PM.png\" alt=\"skype remote work tool\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.skype.com/en/\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">At this point, many of us have already used <a href=\"http://www.skype.com/en/\">Skype</a>. Along with allowing you to host free small virtual meetings, Skype also enables you to create group chats.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">If you want to use the paid version of Skype, you can also have meetings with groups or make international voice calls.</p> \n<h4>18. UberConference</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image-3850.png?width=1500&amp;name=image-3850.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"Uber Conference call with remote team members\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.uberconference.com/\" style=\"font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>With <a href=\"https://www.uberconference.com/\">UberConference</a>, there's no wondering who joined the call, who said what, or what the <em>heck </em>your meeting PIN number is. It also allows screen sharing and has a mobile app.</p> \n<p>You can create video calls in your own name and when someone signs in, you can easily see them on the video calls dashboard. Then, when someone is talking, their video feed will be highlighted so you can easily see what's happening and stay focused.</p> \n<h4>19. Google Calendar</h4> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 1500px; max-height: 844px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.27%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/JHcPdXufCtI\" width=\"1500\" height=\"844\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Rather than having a full conversation over an instant messaging platform about when to have a meeting, you can use G Suite's <a href=\"https://gsuitetips.com/tips/calendar/use-a-team-calendar/\">Google Calendar</a> feature.</p> \n<p>With the feature, you can share your Google Calendar with your colleagues. Then, when you want to schedule a meeting with them, simply search their names and book a suggested time that works.</p> \n<p>When you do this, you can also put notes in the description area such as, \"I'd like to book this meeting to discuss the marketing newsletter. Let me know if this time doesn't work for you.\"</p> \n<h3><strong>20. Howspace</strong></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-05-18%20at%201.21.19%20PM.png?width=2806&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-05-18%20at%201.21.19%20PM.png\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2020-05-18 at 1.21.19 PM\" width=\"2806\" style=\"width: 2806px;\"><a href=\"https://www.howspace.com/\">Howspace</a> is a digital facilitation platform that helps you deliver large initiatives, such as organizational transformation, learning programs, workshops &amp; events for large groups.<br><br>You can inspire co-creation, boost engagement and create sustained impact by facilitating an interactive journey for processes that go beyond daily practices. Easy to use drag and drop editor helps you build your workspace, including chats, polls, surveys and videos. AI helps you to summarize insights for large discussions in real time.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Remote Work Tools For Quick Chats With Colleagues</h3> \n<h4>21. Slack</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Advanced_Search_Slack.png?width=1500&amp;name=Advanced_Search_Slack.png\" alt=\"Advanced Search Slack\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://slack.com/\">Slack</a> is great for real-time communication for one-on-one conversations or with everyone on your team. You can also organize chats by subject, and integrate activity from platforms like Github, Trello, and Pingdom.</p> \n<p>I like the<a href=\"http://blog.ghost.org/distributed-team-tools/\"> thought expressed here</a> that Slack is as close to a virtual office as you can get. You can even create one channel for every client, and invite only the people on that project to be on that channel.</p> \n<p>(Want to learn more about Slack? <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/slack-tips\">Here's a guide</a> to all the hacks you didn't yet know you could do with the platform.)</p> \n<h4>22. WhatsApp</h4> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 1500px; max-height: 844px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.27%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/KMpM0BPkDcs\" width=\"1500\" height=\"844\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>If you have a remote or globally dispersed team, or communicate regularly with international clients or prospects, <a href=\"http://Whatsapp.com\">WhatsApp</a> is a great communication platform that allows you to create group chats with them, send text messages, host multiple-person video calls, or make voice calls for free on a Wi-Fi network. </p> \n<h4>24. Flowdock</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://d2cxspbh1aoie1.cloudfront.net/propaganda-assets/images/landing/default_promo-fe240bc6.gif\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"Flowdock Instant messaging app for remote and dispersed teams\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.flowdock.com/\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.flowdock.com/\">Flowdock</a> is simple and easy-to-use instant messaging app and website similar to Slack. It also integrates with Jira, GitHub, Basecamp, Asana, Assembla, Trello and many other apps. </p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Remote Work Tools For Asset Management</h3> \n<h4>25. Google Drive</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.03.59%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.03.59%20PM.png\" alt=\"google drive remote work tool\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.google.com/drive/\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p>I love <a href=\"https://www.google.com/drive/\">Google Drive</a>, but it does tend to update rather frequently — meaning, just when you’ve figured it out and have all your things organized, things change.</p> \n<p>With that said, it’s free, stores and organizes all of your content and information, and you can work on the same document with multiple people at the same time. </p> \n<h4>26. Dropbox</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.02.54%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.02.54%20PM.png\" alt=\"dropbox business remote work tool\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><em><a href=\"https://www.dropbox.com/?_hp=b&amp;landing=dbv2\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Source</a></em></p> \n<p>Sharing large files doesn’t work so well over email, which is where <a href=\"https://www.dropbox.com/\">Dropbox and Dropbox Business </a>come in.</p> \n<p>This is a great tool for organizing freelancer work. Just have the freelancer upload their documents into monthly folders and message you when their work is in.</p> \n<h4>26. Adobe Creative Cloud</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.01.41%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.01.41%20PM.png\" alt=\"adobe creative cloud remote work tool\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.adobe.com/\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p><a href=\"http://adobe.com\">Adobe Creative Cloud</a> programs like Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator allow you to create design files or visual assets that can then be edited or updated by your team. <br><a href=\"http://canva.com\"></a></p> \n<h4>27. Canva</h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.59.03%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.59.03%20PM.png\" alt=\"canva remote work tool\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"><span style=\"font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.canva.com/\" style=\"font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Source</a></span></p> \n<p>Similar to Adobe, but easier to use for design novices, <a href=\"http://canva.com\">Canva</a> allows you to create team accounts where you can share design templates and assets with your colleagues remotely.</p> \n<p>This ensures you're able to access and edit any design files or brand imagery you might need while working from home.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Remote Work Tools For Announcements and Internal Documentation</h3> \n<h4>28. Confluence</h4> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 1500px; max-height: 844px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.27%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/OLDMHgqxJXE\" width=\"1500\" height=\"844\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence\">Confluence</a> allows you to create an internal blog or wiki for your team. It’s more of a team manager, keeping documents, notes, best practices, product requirements, and plans all in one easily searchable place.</p> \n<p>Pro tip: You can also use the Gliffy integration to do quick wireframes.</p> \n<h4>29. GitHub Wiki</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.57.37%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.57.37%20PM.png\" alt=\"github wiki remote work tool\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://help.github.com/en/github/building-a-strong-community/about-wikis\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p>Savvy inbound marketing companies use <a href=\"https://help.github.com/articles/about-github-wikis/\" style=\"font-size: 1rem;\">GitHub Wiki</a> for employee onboarding by organizing helpful resources for new employees.</p> \n<h4>30. Loom</h4> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 1500px; max-height: 844px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.27%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/3PY6v9s1MU8\" width=\"1500\" height=\"844\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Realize that speaking out loud is a better way to communicate a team announcement, but don't have time to book a meeting?</p> \n<p>With <a href=\"https://www.loom.com/\">Loom</a>, you can record a presentation or just your voice to give an announcement or play-by-play to your team. Then, you can get a link to share the recording and easily circulate it across channels like instant messengers or email.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Remote Work Tools For Tracking Team Progress</h3> \n<h4>31. Time Doctor</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://www.timedoctor.com/assets/images/n76a/popups/Time-tracking.png\" alt=\"Live Support from Time Doctor\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.timedoctor.com/\" style=\"font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>Need to keep a close eye on how your team is spending their time, for client billing or productivity purposes? <a href=\"https://www.timedoctor.com/\">Time Doctor</a> can help you do just that.</p> \n<p>With the tool, you and your team and/or remote freelancers can create projects and start a clock when starting a new task. Then Time Doctor's dashboard shows a report of how many hours your colleague has worked throughout the day and which projects they've spent the most time on.</p> \n<h4>32. Harvest</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://www.getharvest.com/assets/home/product-shot-footer-7ac6e1786fee877400f38bc9628f196b10070f2f8aa401a84281aa576365f180.png\" alt=\"Harvest's easy intuitive timer dashboard.\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.getharvest.com/\" style=\"font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>For keeping track of time and expenses, this is a simple few-frills tool. With <a href=\"https://www.getharvest.com/\">Harvest</a>, you simply create projects or to-do list items and start the clock when you start working on each tasks.</p> \n<p>Then you can see how much time you've spent on different list items, such as writing blog posts, strategizing, or producing marketing emails.</p> \n<h4>33. iDoneThis</h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.53.00%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.53.00%20PM.png\" alt=\"idonethis remote work tool\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"><span style=\"font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://idonethis.com/\" style=\"font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Source</a></span></p> \n<p>I don’t know about you, but sometimes I can’t remember what I did yesterday. <a href=\"https://idonethis.com/\">iDoneThis</a> solves that problem for individuals and teams by sending a \"digest\" of what everyone did.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Remote Work Tools For Team Decision-Making</h3> \n<h4>34. Polly.ai</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.54.51%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.54.51%20PM.png\" alt=\"polly.ai remote work tool \" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>When your team needs to make a decision that doesn't require a full meeting, <a href=\"http://Polly.ai\">Polly.ai</a> enables you to create a survey that you can then send through platforms like Slack. From there, your colleagues can simply vote on an option.</p> \n<h4>35. Doodle</h4> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 1500px; max-height: 844px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.27%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/rJm94ADzJW4\" width=\"1500\" height=\"844\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Need to plan a group meeting? <a href=\"https://doodle.com/make-a-poll\">Doodle</a> is a polling platform that allows you to ask quick questions to your team and see how they vote.</p> \n<p>You can also create a meeting-time poll which enables your team to vote on a meeting time that works best for them so you're able to accommodate schedules.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Navigate the Remote Work Landscape with Helpful Tools</h2> \n<p>Today, your employees must have the ability to effectively do their jobs remotely — they need access to the right resources to help them be as productive at home as they are in an office space.</p> \n<p>It's no secret that everyone works a little differently and has a unique set of challenges. But when our problems have to do organization and productivity, try implement one of the tools mentioned above.</p> \n<p>To learn more about how to master remote work, check out <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/remote-work-tips\">success tips from HubSpot's remote workforce</a>.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's Note: This blog post was originally published in 2015 and was updated for comprehensiveness and freshness in July 2020.</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img
