PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%202.01.41%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn77@2020_5/2020-07-30/1596118306042_72fbd270df091e6f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.59.03%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.59.03%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn41@2020_4/2020-07-30/1596118305823_acb3d5685f362562.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.57.37%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.57.37%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn45@2020_2/2020-07-30/1596118309907_014122d523179fee.webp","https://www.timedoctor.com/assets/images/n76a/popups/Time-tracking.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn29@2020_5/2020-07-30/1596118305916_ecce7b38b4c8b8fa.webp","https://www.getharvest.com/assets/home/product-shot-footer-7ac6e1786fee877400f38bc9628f196b10070f2f8aa401a84281aa576365f180.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn1@2020_4/2020-07-30/1596118308204_494e68511b662b4c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.53.00%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.53.00%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn17@2020_5/2020-07-30/1596118305208_6c54c1fa407f5e62.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.54.51%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-04-15%20at%201.54.51%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn5@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596118308201_180522e76dc4a4fc.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fremote-work-tools&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn9@2020_5/2020-07-30/1596118310776_ad14ffb8b2eba1d4.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-07-30 22:11:40","updatedTime":"2020-07-30 14:11:40","title":"HubSpot Ran A Co-marketing Campaign: Here's What We Learned","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/co-marketing-campaign","description":"<p>Co-marketing campaigns can be undeniably effective for increasing brand awareness, reaching new audiences, or creating amazing — and potentially delicious — new products.</p>  \n<p>For instance, consider the partnership between Doritos and Taco Bell, which resulted in <a href=\"https://www.tacobell.com/food/tacos/nacho-cheese-doritos-locos-tacos\">Doritos Locos Tacos</a>, a delicious product promoted in a brilliant co-marketing campaign. If you haven't heard of the partnership, watch the story unfold in this promotional video:</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/q3Q4DwKsUuI\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>In this case, the two B2C companies saw success in their venture — and now, the popular item is a mainstay on the Taco Bell menu. Marketers at the two companies can attribute the home-run to a certain tactic: co-marketing.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>A wonderful way for two companies to partner together, co-marketing can create opportunities for businesses to reach new audiences and delight existing audiences at the same time.</p> \n<p>For instance, HubSpot has the Partner program, which offers unique benefits, including co-marketing opportunities. Recently, the team decided to run a few tests to see if co-marketing could expand past content offers — and what that would look like.</p> \n<p>Essentially, the team aimed to answer three questions:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>How do we move co-marketing programming forward?</li> \n <li>How do we keep providing top-notch education?</li> \n <li>How do we keep our lead number high while creating value for our audience?</li> \n</ul> \n<p>HubSpot Academy gives educational value to its audiences, so it was a great channel for partners to get involved. It's the home of hundreds of <a href=\"https://www.g2.com/products/hubspot-academy/reviews\">world-leading</a> courses about marketing and sales. Lessons even include tools to help viewers take actionable steps as they learn.</p> \n<p><em>\"Maybe, to expand co-marketing opportunities,\"</em> the team hypothesized, <em>\"We could have partners upload their own lessons within courses and certification tracks. They can demo how their tools work with the current lesson in practice.\"</em></p> \n<p>This could mean more traffic from audiences with interests that align closely with partners' target audiences.</p> \n<p>Having settled on the experiment, HubSpot's team then needed to stop and think through possible speed bumps. For starters, will partners be able to drive leads with Academy? Will HubSpot audiences even be interested in offers?</p> \n<p>Here, let's explore how HubSpot's Academy team created and ran a co-marketing campaign, and lessons they learned that you can apply to your own co-marketing efforts.</p> \n<h2>HubSpot's Co-marketing Campaign</h2> \n<p>To start, Moz hosted a video lesson for HubSpot Academy's Content Marketing Course.</p> \n<p>\"<a href=\"https://www.google.com/search?ei=4L8QX9ihJaawytMP25OayA4&amp;q=hubspot+creating+topic+clusters+and+pillar+pages&amp;oq=hubspot+creating+topic+clusters+and+pillar+pages&amp;gs_lcp=CgZwc3ktYWIQAzIFCCEQoAE6BAgAEEc6BAgAEEM6BQgAELEDOgIIADoHCAAQsQMQQzoICAAQsQMQkQI6BQgAEJECOgYIABAWEB46BQghEKsCOggIIRAWEB0QHjoHCCEQChCgAVCNgRZYlqwWYNSsFmgAcAV4AIABvgGIAbggkgEEMzguOZgBAKABAaoBB2d3cy13aXo&amp;sclient=psy-ab&amp;ved=0ahUKEwjYkcSe1dLqAhUmmHIEHduJBukQ4dUDCAw&amp;uact=5\">Creating Topic Clusters and Pillar Pages</a>\" was a demo for <a href=\"https://moz.com/explorer\">Moz's free Keyword Explorer tool</a>.</p> \n<p>Users can leverage the lesson's content for keyword research, making finding value blog topics easy and organized.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/HubSpot%20Ran%20A%20Co-marketing%20Campaign%20Heres%20What%20We%20Learned.png\" alt=\"Moz's lesson on creating topic clusters.\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><span style=\"font-family: 'times new roman', times;\"><a href=\"https://www.google.com/search?ei=4L8QX9ihJaawytMP25OayA4&amp;q=hubspot+creating+topic+clusters+and+pillar+pages&amp;oq=hubspot+creating+topic+clusters+and+pillar+pages&amp;gs_lcp=CgZwc3ktYWIQAzIFCCEQoAE6BAgAEEc6BAgAEEM6BQgAELEDOgIIADoHCAAQsQMQQzoICAAQsQMQkQI6BQgAEJECOgYIABAWEB46BQghEKsCOggIIRAWEB0QHjoHCCEQChCgAVCNgRZYlqwWYNSsFmgAcAV4AIABvgGIAbggkgEEMzguOZgBAKABAaoBB2d3cy13aXo&amp;sclient=psy-ab&amp;ved=0ahUKEwjYkcSe1dLqAhUmmHIEHduJBukQ4dUDCAw&amp;uact=5\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>\"Folks go through this course and see a video saying, <em>'Hey, you can use this tool for free to do exactly what this course is teaching you,'</em>\" Margot Mazur, Senior Co-marketing Manager, told me.</p> \n<p>It worked.</p> \n<p>Results positively supported the questions HubSpot's team asked. In four months, the video earned 8,000 lesson views, and 6,000 clicks to Moz. In total, Moz earned 1,460 new contacts.</p> \n<p>Similar experiments also brought favorable results. After reaching out, partners could host a lesson, demo a relevant resource, and share a CTA with a direct link.</p> \n<p>From this successful campaign, the co-marketing team guessed that the tactic could be beneficial in other areas of HubSpot.</p> \n<p>For instance, the team considered trying the same experiment during <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/adapt2020?_ga=2.245523268.1927936983.1595381564-940436819.1565181751\">Adapt 2020</a>, a series of webinars that help audiences adapt to different business challenges.</p> \n<p>\"I reached out to partners to see if they wanted to lead weekly webinars,\" recalls Mazur. \"The experience for that has been really good — it's positive for both parties.\"</p> \n<p>Webinars, similar to the lessons on Academy, were released for Adapt. This one featured Sally Woellner, Template Design Lead, talking about creating brand kits using <a href=\"https://www.canva.com/\">Canva</a>:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Canva%20BK%20with%20HS.png?width=1015&amp;name=Canva%20BK%20with%20HS.png\" width=\"1015\" style=\"width: 1015px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"Adapt 2020 lesson on website design with Canva and HubSpot.\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><span style=\"font-family: 'times new roman', times;\"><a href=\"https://community.hubspot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Designing-a-Website-That-Works-For-You-Canva-HubSpot-Webinar/m-p/348358?_ga=2.17473273.1173791517.1594654110-940436819.1565181751#M17144\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>The webinar also explained how to use themes in HubSpot, the importance of website design and helpful design tools including Canva.</p> \n<p>Another expansion of co-marketing opportunities comes from the HubSpot Blogs. Mazur thought blog posts could be an excellent way to add more value to partners and readers.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/HubSpot%20Ran%20A%20Co-marketing%20Campaign%20Heres%20What%20We%20Learned-1.png\" alt=\"Example of co-marketing on.a blog.\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><span style=\"font-family: 'times new roman', times;\"><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/sales-email-templates-examples?_ga=2.18039929.1927936983.1595381564-940436819.1565181751\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>Posts like the one above display how partners can leverage HubSpot's Blogs for guest posts. These posts tackled topics that interest audiences of both parties, and ultimately result in driving leads for partners <em>and</em> providing value for HubSpot readers.</p> \n<p>At this point, the co-marketing team identified four tactics for improving partner involvement: Academy education courses, blogs, quarterly campaigns (Such as Adapt), and content offers.</p> \n<p>So, what did the co-marketing team take away from this experiment? Let's dive into four lessons they learned, next.</p> \n<h3>1. Co-marketing can expand — and should.</h3> \n<p>The purpose of HubSpot's experiment was to find effective co-marketing opportunities across a range of teams and on various company platforms. The results demonstrate how co-marketing can be a strategy used company-wide to reach business goals.</p> \n<p>With the inclusion of blogs, video, and content offers, partnerships can be leveraged to provide value for both parties. To try a similar tactic, you might consider running a co-marketing campaign for a team you normally wouldn't.</p> \n<p>For instance, maybe your company produces webinars and blog content. Those are channels that can benefit from a guest lesson or post about something that's relevant to the industry.</p> \n<h3>2. Videos perform better than ebooks for partner content.</h3> \n<p>About two years ago, one of the highest-performing co-marketing avenues was an ebook offer.</p> \n<p>Now, however, Mazur and her team have found that videos perform better than ebooks when it comes to partner content.</p> \n<p>Take the Academy lessons and webinars, for instance. Results from those two tactics have proven more successful, averaging a thousand more submissions than ebooks. In a world where social audiences often <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing?__hstc=20629287.baf2406400c73bbe46641b2b9cd8a38f.1563824949326.1584540014200.1584545281370.484&amp;__hssc=20629287.18.1584545281370&amp;__hsfp=3755920611&amp;_ga=2.18039929.1927936983.1595381564-940436819.1565181751\">prefer video to text</a>, adapting to this shift has served the team well.</p> \n<h3>3. Driving partner leads through new channels is difficult.</h3> \n<p>Even though the experiment saw success, it wasn't without some low moments. \"Driving leads for partners is difficult, and we have to continue to work to make that easier for partners,\" notes Mazur.</p> \n<p>She says low performance could be a result of account sign-ups being confused with partner sign-ups. Now that there's proof it's possible, one of the next steps in this process is to make sure partners have a way to earn more leads.</p> \n<h3>4. Partners find value in product sign-ups from other channels.</h3> \n<p>Even though leads weren't record-breaking from the first experiment, partners found value in those Academy signups. The excellent performance is because of the types of partners and content chosen.</p> \n<p>Mazur's team was tasked with finding the right partners to host lessons for Academy. The lessons had to make sense, be actionable, reputable, and a natural fit into the larger, existing course.</p> \n<p>To illustrate, one of the courses on Academy is \"<a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/lessons/improving-website-performance?library=true&amp;_ga=2.82454358.1927936983.1595381564-940436819.1565181751\">The Importance of Website Performance</a>.\" One of the lessons, \"Using Heatmaps to Optimize Performance,\" is led by a Customer Experience professional at Hotjar. In the lesson, we see a tutorial about how to use Hotjar's heatmaps to analyze web page engagement.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/HubSpot%20Ran%20A%20Co-marketing%20Campaign%20Heres%20What%20We%20Learned-3.png\" alt=\"Hotjar's lesson on using heatmaps to analyze web performance.\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><span style=\"font-family: 'times new roman', times;\"><a href=\"https://app.hubspot.com/academy/53/lessons/707/3606?_ga=2.82454358.1927936983.1595381564-940436819.1565181751\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>A lesson about using a helpful tool to analyze website performance in this course — great fit, right? Now, imagine if the Hotjar lesson was inserted into a Social Media Certification course — not as helpful.</p> \n<p>Because the subjects fit, the audiences watching the course will most likely find content from both partners equally useful — which, ultimately, results in higher-quality leads.</p> \n<p>Now that the Academy strategy has proven successful, Mazur's team wants to keep it going. They're going to continue identifying partners for more Academy lessons, and, in addition to Academy lessons, they will keep supporting Adapt with more partnership opportunities.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, Mazur's team will continue to offer creative partner driven solutions across HubSpot to reach business goals.</p> \n<p>What are some <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-cobranding-partnerships?_ga=2.82454358.1927936983.1595381564-940436819.1565181751\">co-marketing campaigns</a> that you love? Personally, the Doritos Locos Taco is pretty up there (As is the <a href=\"https://www.tacobell.com/food/drinks/mountain-dew-baja-blast-freeze\">Mountain Dew Baja Blast</a> drink — also a permanent addition to the menu). How can you include some winning tactics into your next campaign?</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fco-marketing-campaign&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 23 Jul 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/HubSpot%20Ran%20A%20Co-marketing%20Campaign%20Heres%20What%20We%20Learned.png","linkMd5":"6e9668f346c92d4eb746f2e6cbfeefea","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn65@2020_3/2020-07-30/1596118301903_6cbef713229bf49b.webp","author":"Kayla Carmicheal","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/HubSpot%20Ran%20A%20Co-marketing%20Campaign%20Heres%20What%20We%20Learned.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn65@2020_3/2020-07-30/1596118301903_6cbef713229bf49b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Canva%20BK%20with%20HS.png?width=1015&name=Canva%20BK%20with%20HS.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020-07-30/1596118311246_efe631e416056d8f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/HubSpot%20Ran%20A%20Co-marketing%20Campaign%20Heres%20What%20We%20Learned-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn85@2020_2/2020-07-30/1596118311554_3f44507f925fada7.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/HubSpot%20Ran%20A%20Co-marketing%20Campaign%20Heres%20What%20We%20Learned-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn49@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596118312723_2e08cdf8ead260fa.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fco-marketing-campaign&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn41@2020_1/2020-07-30/1596118313372_fd85cb8bdebeaf72.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-07-30 22:11:40","updatedTime":"2020-07-30 14:11:40","title":"7 Tips for Working Remotely with Roommates or Family, From HubSpot Marketers","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/working-remotely-with-roommates-or-family","description":"<p>While working remotely offers challenges of low visibility, loneliness, and feeling out of the loop, the ability to work from home also comes with major perks.</p>  \n<p>For example, if you worked remotely in the past, you might have had the whole house to yourself, could pick the perfect workspace for your needs, and had almost total flexibility in your day.</p> \n<p>As someone who worked remotely part-time before 2020, the pure silence was something I absolutely loved about remote workdays. While I'd still go to my office for in-person meetings during the first few days of the week, I'd usually work remotely on Thursdays and Fridays to avoid noise or interruptions while focusing on heads-down projects. These turned out to be some of my most productive days of the week.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>But now, as more workplaces are going partially or fully remote, employees like me are finding themselves working with family or roommates nearby for the first time. At this point, this change of environment has become a surprising and unique challenge for even the most experienced remote employees.</p> \n<p>Even when you get along with family or roommates, putting your professional needs before personal life needs during work hours can feel uncomfortable or tense.</p> \n<p>Aside from dealing with this new sense of discomfort, your workday also changes in a number of logistical ways. For example, the house might get louder during the day, planning uninterrupted video calls might feel strenuous, you might have to share your precious workspace, and some roommates or family members might have trouble adapting to remote work boundaries.</p> \n<p>In fact, no matter how well you plan out your daily household routine, there's always room for unexpected mishaps.</p> \n<p>Remember the viral video where a CNN correspondent's children strutted into their father's video interview? If not, here it is:</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/IKxqy9SJ-0I\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>While the man in the video might have felt horrified at the time, many people who've been in similar situations actually found the incident to be adorable and relatable.</p> \n<p>In 2020, a lot of us are thinking about <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IKxqy9SJ-0I\">the CNN contributor's video call</a>&nbsp;as we navigate working remotely with family or roommates.</p> \n<p>To help you navigate a shared remote work experience, here's a list of tips from HubSpot employees who've mastered working from home with loved ones or roommates in close proximity.</p> \n<h2>How to Work Remotely With Roommates or Family</h2> \n<h3>1. Give roommates or working family members as much space as you can.</h3> \n<p>Remember, you should <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/books-make-you-more-empathetic?_ga=2.140242931.1749610492.1595602855-631527517.1595282187\">always have empathy</a>&nbsp;and respect for your roommates or loved ones and their personal space. That doesn't stop when you all have to work from home together. In this situation, you should start to think of your roommates and adult family members like co-workers.</p> \n<p>Rather than sitting right next to a roommate, distracting them, or doing something loudly as you would after work hours, create an environment that allows everyone to work well at the same time.</p> \n<p>If you have a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/remote-workspace?_ga=2.140242931.1749610492.1595602855-631527517.1595282187\">desk in your room or your own office space already set up</a>, try to work there as much as possible to prevent encroaching on the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/remote-workspace\">workspace</a>&nbsp;of roommates that don't have the same space in their room. If no one has a desk or a room they can work in, have each roommate designate where they'll be working each day so that everyone is at a proper distance. You might also want to consider days where you'll relocate to new workspaces in case anyone needs a change of scenery.</p> \n<h3>2. Communicate about your schedules and expectations.</h3> \n<p>Almost all the colleagues that I spoke to explained that communication is key when working remotely with roommates and family.</p> \n<p>With strong communication, you can prevent someone from accidentally walking into the background of your meeting, two video calls happening in one room or other at-home issues that can impact your workday.</p> \n<p>\"Before each workday, have a conversation on what your roommates, partners, or family members schedule that day is going to look like. This way, you'll have a good sense of when their day starts, ends, and when they will be taking a break so you can plan accordingly,\" says Jennifer Stefancik, a marketing manager on our HubSpot Academy team.</p> \n<p>If you have children at home, you can also use a morning conversation to talk with adult family members or partners to determine who'll be watching them at different points of the day, helping them with schoolwork, or making them lunch while other family members are in meetings or tuned into work.</p> \n<p>While you're discussing schedules with family members or colleagues, you should also discuss your expectations and professional boundaries.</p> \n<p>\"If you don’t communicate your expectations for behavior during your meetings, they won’t know how to behave,\" says Rebecca White, a junior staff writer for the HubSpot Blog. \"For example, you can say something like ‘I have meetings from 8 a.m. to 9 a.m. and 10 a.m. to 11 a.m. tomorrow. During these meetings, please no cooking or TV. You can walk around, but no talking or sound. I’ll let you know when the meeting is over!’\"</p> \n<h3>3. Avoid interrupting roommate or family-member meetings at all costs.</h3> \n<p>Think of your roommate or adult family member like a coworker. Would you barge into a colleague's meeting to ask them a quick question? Would you walk into a meeting room when the door is closed and people are talking inside? I really hope not!</p> \n<p>\"To avoid interrupting (or potential embarrassment), always assume your roommate, partner, or family member is in a meeting before talking or making loud sounds. You can communicate with them via text or Slack. Or, my personal favorite has been waving my arms in the air to get their attention!) to check and see if they are on a call,\" says Stefancik.</p> \n<p>As Stefancik mentions, there are many ways to communicate with roommates aside from knocking on the door, yelling their name, or walking up and talking to them. For example, use Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, or text messages to ask a roommate a question. Or, if it can wait, write it down in your phone's Notes and plan to ask the question later.</p> \n<p>Additionally, if your roommate or loved one is working in a common space, like a dining room or a kitchen, be quiet and remain out of the camera's view if you must enter the room.</p> \n<p>On the other hand, if you're the roommate who's been forced to work in the kitchen or living room, you should also set boundaries to ensure your housemates don't cause any interruptions.</p> \n<p>If you're stuck working in a common space, you might also want to consider setting designated times where roommates can walk freely into common areas, cook, eat, or watch TV each day. However, try to be somewhat flexible. Your roommates are still human and might need to cook an early dinner, grab a quick snack, or watch a show to relax after they finish work.</p> \n<h3>4. Know when to make compromises.</h3> \n<p>Yes, your housemates should respect your space and try to avoid interrupting you at all costs. But, at the same time, you'll want to make sure your schedule isn't interrupting them too much.</p> \n<p>For example, if one roommate is sitting at the kitchen table and the rest of the house is empty, find a place to sit where you can do your video calls far away from them rather than taking over their territory or interrupting their day.</p> \n<p>As you approach your workday, remember that your roommate might be making compromises to make you comfortable, so you should also make compromises for them.</p> \n<p>Being <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/digital-body-language\">empathetic</a>&nbsp;to housemates is something Anna Fitzgerald, a HubSpot Blog staff writer, strongly advises.</p> \n<p>\"I’m working in an apartment with three roommates where the Wi-Fi really only works in the living room and kitchen, so we’ve had to practice a lot of empathy,\" says Fitzgerald</p> \n<p>\"One day, my roommate was on a Zoom call in front of our silverware drawer, so I ended up eating my lunch without a fork. The next day when she was on a call, I tripped over my computer charger, catapulting my laptop from a high-top table to the floor with a shockingly loud thump,\" Fitzgerald shares. \"We know we’re doing our best and are quick to forgive as we learn to be coworkers as well as roommates.\"</p> \n<p>To add to the sense of empathy and understanding, be sure to make time to bond with your roommates after you spend the day keeping your distance during work hours.</p> \n<p>\"We try to stay out of each other’s way as much as possible during the day and then eat 'family dinner' together. It’s a great way to make sure we stay productive during the day and disconnect at the end,\" Fitzgerald adds.</p> \n<h3>5. Avoid overlapping meetings or presentations.</h3> \n<p>As mentioned above, communicating with your family and roommates will help you prevent embarrassing moments during meetings or interruptions that could affect your work. Aside from this, you should also communicate to make sure each roommate can participate in, host, or present in meetings successfully during the week. If you don't have multiple rooms in your house, this also means making sure your meetings don't overlap.</p> \n<p>\"We have a small space that isn't easy to soundproof. Early in the week and at the beginning of every day, my husband and I go over our schedule to determine if we have meetings that overlap,\" says Crystal King, a senior marketing manager. \"If one meeting is really important -- like a presentation for a webinar -- we'll shift schedules to accommodate. We've found that our colleagues are all pretty understanding.\"</p> \n<p>Stafancik echoed this statement by advising, \"If you are sharing a working space, look at your schedule and see if you'll be presenting or talking a lot in any meetings. If so, plan ahead to either work in a different space or see if your 'coworker' can move to another space during that time.\"</p> \n<h3>6. Create a realistic daily routine.</h3> \n<p>When you're working with family or roommates, having a household routine will help keep everyone aligned and allow everything to run smoothly.</p> \n<p>If you have roommates, this routine could include things like cleaning times or roommate bonding times that prevent apartment messes or socialization from cutting into your work hours.</p> \n<p>If you're working with family or have children at home, a family routine can be even more important. For example, this routine could determine activities that your children will do while you are occupied in a meeting, or which parent will watch a child during different times of the day.</p> \n<p>According to Nataly Kelly, HubSpot's VP of Localization, \"Kids thrive on routine. We all know this, but it's hard to not have a schedule for them when you yourself are working on the clock and have scheduled meetings.\"</p> \n<p>While a routine can be an important guideline for each day, Kelly adds that it's important to remain flexible if your daily plan goes off track.</p> \n<p>\"I believe a routine is great. But, don't stress too much about sticking to a strict schedule with children, because they might not always want to move along.\" Kelly shares.</p> \n<p>To help her children stay on a schedule, and avoid interrupting her own work, Kelly provides them with visual signals to show that she's focusing on work or in a meeting.</p> \n<p>\"I set up a timer in each major area of my house so that my kids can see the clock counting down without having to ask me how much time is left on my work calls,\" Kelly explains. \"Then, when the timer goes off (one minute after the end of my meetings), they know it's time to change to their next daily activity.\"</p> \n<p>\"This doesn't always work. My kids are like everyone else's and don't always listen,\" Kelly notes. \"But, it helps.\"</p> \n<h3>7. Don't forget to bond with your roommates or loved ones.</h3> \n<p>Colleagues that work well together often take time for team bonding and non-work related activities. So, why shouldn't you practice the same tactics with the roommates or family members you live with?</p> \n<p>Being sure to tune out at the end of the day, planning activities with roommates, or spending time with family after you've clocked out will further help you communicate with them, work better alongside them, and maintain your work-life balance.</p> \n<p>\"It's important to carve out mental separations between work and family time,\" says Sherry Ng, a senior marketing manager. \"I recommend always scheduling time to decompress after work so that you don't jump right into time with family and friends while still thinking about emails or projects. It allows you to be more present with those you love.\"</p> \n<h2>Embracing Your \"New Coworkers\"</h2> \n<p>Working in the same house with roommates or family can be a major challenge, especially if you've never worked in this type of environment before. As you continue to navigate this work style, keep these overarching tips in common.</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Be empathic: Remember, although you might be compromising to help your roommates, they might be compromising for you. Be sure to think about what you're going through, their needs, and how you can both work well together.</li> \n <li>Set boundaries: Although you should be empathetic and respectful to your roommates or family members, it's important to set boundaries such as when you need silence for meetings, how your roommates should behave to avoid disruption or your personal space needs.</li> \n <li>Maintain work-life balance: Even though you should think of your roommates like coworkers during the day, keep things casual like usual during the nights and weekends. This helps to prevent work from sucking the fun out of your family or roommate relationships and also leaves you time to pleasantly bond with them.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>To learn more about successfully working from home, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/remote-work-tips?_ga=2.140242931.1749610492.1595602855-631527517.1595282187\">check out these tips from some of our remote staff</a>. Interested in learning about how to achieve <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/work-life-balance-tips?_ga=2.140242931.1749610492.1595602855-631527517.1595282187\">work-life balance</a>? You might also enjoy this blog post.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fworking-remotely-with-roommates-or-family&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 27 Jul 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/working-remotely-with-roommates-or-family.jpg#keepProtocol","linkMd5":"0e8aac08ce536763f3e5a3ae6c80b835","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn37@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596118303798_bf777faf3f6bde9d.webp","metaImg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/working-remotely-with-roommates-or-family.jpg#keepProtocol","author":"pbump@hubspot.com (Pamela Bump)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fworking-remotely-with-roommates-or-family&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn97@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596118304809_56502eaf740a3cb5.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-07-30 22:11:41","updatedTime":"2020-07-30 14:11:41","title":"Totally Free Microsoft Excel Templates That Make Marketing Easier","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-with-excel-templates-list","description":"<p>Many of us can recall a time in high school when we were sitting in math class and thinking, \"When am I <em style=\"letter-spacing: 0px; background-color: transparent;\">ever</em> going to use this stuff in the real world?\"</p> \n<p>And then we suddenly find ourselves in the real world, only to realize that numbers actually do play a pivotal role in what we do -- especially in digital marketing.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p> \n<p>The trouble is, many marketers are right-brained, meaning Excel spreadsheets riddled with numbers and formulas aren't all that inviting. Making them from scratch can be especially intimidating.</p> \n<p>While we won't argue with that, we will say that the advantages of leveraging Excel's functionality to organize information and streamline tasks are unparalleled. To help those of you looking for a way to sharpen your skills, we've put together a detailed list of ways you can start using Excel to simplify your marketing tasks. Complete with templates, these suggestions will have you making strides in no time. Know what's even better? You can <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/excel-templates-to-make-marketing-easier\">download this full collection of Excel templates</a> in one fell swoop.</p> \n<div> \n <p class=\"p1\"></p> \n</div> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/thank-you/marketing-budget-templates\">A Marketing Budget Template</a></h3> \n<p><strong><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/marketing-product-budget-template-1.png?width=602&amp;name=marketing-product-budget-template-1.png\" alt=\"marketing budget template in excel showing monthly spend\" width=\"602\" style=\"width: 602px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></strong></p> \n<p>While marketing budgets vary from business to business, the need for structure and a clear sense of alignment between your goals and your spending is critical across the board. To ensure you're always prepared for unanticipated costs, it's important that you're not only allocating your budget thoughtfully and properly, but that you're also keeping tabs on how closely you're sticking to your projected expenses.</p> \n<p>If you want to avoid a mess at the end of the month or quarter, <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\">take a look at this collection of 8 marketing budget templates</a>, designed to help you organize your marketing spend better. From product marketing, to website redesign, to content marketing, to events, these templates serve as a guide for marketers to visualize and track their expenses to avoid overspending.</p> \n<p>The collection also contains a master marketing <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-manage-marketing-budget-free-templates\">budget template</a> that'll help you generate a high-level visualization of your marketing budget on both a month-by-month and quarterly basis.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-templates\">Social Media Posting Schedule</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/social-media-post-schedule-template.jpg?width=690&amp;name=social-media-post-schedule-template.jpg\" alt=\"social media posting schedule in excel with days and times of the week\" width=\"690\" style=\"width: 690px;\">You might already use a <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/social-inbox\">social media scheduler</a> to manage and publish your posts every week, but you still need a place to draft your social copy and decide which posts will go to which social networks.</p> \n<p>And because most social media schedulers allow you to upload social post copy in bulk, from a spreadsheet, it behooves you to have an Excel template designed for this purpose. With that in mind, we created the Excel template shown above.</p> \n<p>This social media posting schedule allows you to draft each social post, the date/time it is to be posted, the message you want to publish, and any link you want to accompany your message (that link could be a blog post, registration page, an ebook landing page, you name it).</p> \n<p>Once you've drafted all of your social posts for the week, month, or quarter, you can sort them by social network and upload your Excel file into your social media platform of choice.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/editorial-calendar-templates\">A Blog Editorial Calendar</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/blog-editorial-calendar-templates-1.png?width=524&amp;name=blog-editorial-calendar-templates-1.png\" width=\"524\" style=\"width: 524px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"blog editorial calendar in excel for topic planning\"></p> \n<p>Blogging plays a significant role in your ability to attract visitors and leads to your website. But managing a blog is one of those responsibilities that's easier said than done.</p> \n<p>Whether you're struggling with ideation, consistency, or simply just lacking organization, an editorial calendar can often serve as the solution you need to refocus your blogging efforts and generate even more traffic and leads from your content. Visualize the blog posts you plan to publish in a given week or month makes it easier to define overarching themes, keep track of ideas, manage contributions, and prioritize strategic distribution.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/blog-editorial-calendar\">Use this editorial calendar template</a> as the starting point for keeping track of all of your business' content. It'll help you be more mindful of topic selection, buyer personas, keyword inclusions, and CTA alignment.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-determine-your-smart-marketing-goals\">A SMART Goal Matrix</a></h3> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/00-Blog-Related_Images/SMART_Goals_Excel_Templates.png?width=699&amp;name=SMART_Goals_Excel_Templates.png\" alt=\"smart marketing goals template in excel that includes slots for time period and numerical metric\" title=\"SMART_Goals_Excel_Templates.png\" width=\"699\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<p>Whether you're planning for a new year, quarter, or month, defining a clear set of goals is critical for driving the direction of your marketing efforts and priorities.</p> \n<p>Do you need help not only setting <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33898/How-to-Set-SMART-Marketing-Goals-for-2013-TEMPLATE.aspx\">marketing objectives</a>, but actually achieving them? Start with <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-determine-your-smart-marketing-goals\">these SMART goal planning templates</a>. Rooted in specificity, measurability, attainability, relevancy, and timeliness, these templates will help you set your team up for success while providing you with a tool for identifying your greatest marketing needs.</p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/seo-template-guide\">An On-Page SEO Template</a></h3> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/00-Blog-Related_Images/SEO_Templates_Excel.png?width=669&amp;name=SEO_Templates_Excel.png\" alt=\"on-page seo template in excel with URL, social media details, and calls to action\" title=\"SEO_Templates_Excel.png\" width=\"669\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<p>When it comes to SEO, there's a lot for marketers to remember in order to see results. (Put another way, there's a lot for marketers to forget.) With search engines evolving and algorithm changes turning your existing strategy on its head from time to time, it can be easy to feel overwhelmed and push off revamping your SEO strategy. However, SEO should never be treated like an afterthought.</p> \n<p>If you're looking for the light at the end of the tunnel, pull up <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/seo-template-guide\">this handy SEO template created in Excel</a>. Designed to make the process of managing your SEO efforts a whole lot easier, marketers can use this template to guide their strategy step-by-step or pass it off to their webmaster to serve as a helpful guide. It focuses on not keywords and SEO best practices while providing tips and tricks to identify nuances and increase productivity.</p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/google-ads-ppc-kit\">A Google Ads Campaign Tracker</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/google-ads-campaign-template.jpg?width=690&amp;name=google-ads-campaign-template.jpg\" alt=\"google ads campaign tracker in excel that includes ad variations and formats\" width=\"690\" style=\"width: 690px;\"></p> \n<p>If you’re doing your Google Ads campaigns right, they probably aren't exactly walks in the park. That's because to get the most bang for your buck, you've set up multiple campaigns with multiple ad groups and have variations of your campaigns -- all with different content. Not only that, you're (hopefully) also keeping track of those campaigns to determine which ones to shut off, add more money to, or tweak.</p> \n<p>Sounds like a lot to keep track of, right? But take a deep breath. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/template-managing-and-organizing-google-adwords-campaigns\">This Google Ads tracking template</a> can keep you on top of your Google Ads game. It'll help you catch mistakes and implement best practices across all the different campaigns and ad groups you're running -- for the top, middle, <em>and</em> bottom of the funnel. Not to mention, it's a perfect complement to that SEO template you've started using.</p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-content-calendar\">A Social Media Content Calendar</a></h3> \n<p><strong><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/00-Blog-Related_Images/Social_Media_Publishing_Calendar.png?width=669&amp;name=Social_Media_Publishing_Calendar.png\" alt=\"social media content calendar in excel with color coding for type and slots for each day\" title=\"Social_Media_Publishing_Calendar.png\" width=\"669\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></strong></p> \n<p>Since you’re probably generating tons of clicks from your Google Ads campaigns and writing awesome content thanks to your blogging editorial calendar, you're going to need some help figuring out how to spread the love on social. We've got just the thing.</p> \n<p>The <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-content-calendar\">social media calendar template</a> is the perfect resource for helping you scale and streamline your social media marketing. When you use Excel to break out separate worksheets for each social network you're using, you'll be able to keep a repository of content ideas so you're never struck by writer's block, and always have something to post.</p> \n<p>It's also worth mentioning that Excel really comes in handy when it comes to Twitter, as it has the ability to count your characters to help you write tweets that stay within the 140 character limit.</p> \n<h3>8. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-calculate-your-leads-goal-for-sales-and-marketing-alignment\">Lead Scoring &amp; Tracking Template</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/service-level-agreement-sla-template.png?width=690&amp;name=service-level-agreement-sla-template.png\" alt=\"sla template in excel that shows cumulative goal tracking over the course of a year\" width=\"690\" style=\"width: 690px;\"></p> \n<p>It's no secret that sales and marketing are known to have a pretty rocky relationship history. Sales might think marketing isn't generating enough leads, while marketing might think their sales reps aren't capitalizing on the leads they're sending over. When it comes down to it, though, finger-pointing doesn't grow a business.</p> \n<p>In an effort to better align your sales and marketing teams, turn to<a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-calculate-your-leads-goal-for-sales-and-marketing-alignment\"> this template for creating a service-level agreement (SLA).</a> Generally speaking, an SLA is a contract that defines the expectations sales has for marketing leads (both quantity and quality), as well as the expectations that marketing has for how sales will act on qualified leads.</p> \n<p>With this customizable SLA template in your toolbox, you'll have the information you need to reduce tension, define a concrete monthly lead generation goal, track and measure the success of specific lead generation channels, and keep close tabs on your current sales close rates.</p> \n<h3>9. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/inbound-marketing-calculator\">A Leads and Traffic Goal Calculator</a></h3> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Traffic_and_Leads_Calculator_Excel.png?width=669&amp;name=Traffic_and_Leads_Calculator_Excel.png\" alt=\"leads and traffic goal calculator in excel that includes new revenue and percentage revenue needed to make goal\" title=\"Traffic_and_Leads_Calculator_Excel.png\" width=\"669\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<p>You have to set a leads goal, but you don't know where to start. Then, once you finally figure that out, you have to determine how much traffic you need to hit that goal ... but you're not sure what approach to take there, either.</p> \n<p>Sounds like you could use hand calculating your leads and traffic goals. Luckily, <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/inbound-marketing-calculator\">there's an Excel template for that</a>. Rather than try to sort of these numbers on your own, this template is designed to take care of the math and leave you with a clear picture of what you need to accomplish in order to achieve your traffic and leads goals <em>and</em> ensure the health of your inbound marketing strategy.</p> \n<h3>10. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/monthly-marketing-reporting-template\">Your Monthly Marketing Metrics</a></h3> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/00-Blog-Related_Images/Monthly_Marketing_Metrics_Excel.png?width=669&amp;name=Monthly_Marketing_Metrics_Excel.png\" alt=\"monthly marketing metrics template in excel that includes rows for direct traffic, email marketing, and other channels to calculate month over month growth\" title=\"Monthly_Marketing_Metrics_Excel.png\" width=\"669\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<p>Is there a feeling sweeter than hitting all of your goals for the month? How about communicating your success to your boss? Excel spreadsheets can be used to prepare comprehensive reports of your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/34054/The-6-Marketing-Metrics-Your-CEO-Actually-Cares-About-Cheat-Sheet.aspx\">marketing metrics</a> to send off to your boss -- and there's no need to work from scratch. (After all, you've already so worked hard this month.)</p> \n<p>To simplify your reporting, <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/monthly-marketing-reporting-template\">check out these monthly marketing metrics templates</a> (and the corresponding PowerPoint template). Each, month, you can update them quickly and easily to reflect your monthly visits, leads, customers, and conversion rates. From there, you'll have everything you need to accurately track and report on which channels are performing best. Every boss loves to see ROI, so you can't go wrong with these templates.</p> \n<h3>11. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/monthly-marketing-reporting-template-1\">Essential KPI Tracker</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/essential-kpi-tracking-template.jpg?width=690&amp;name=essential-kpi-tracking-template.jpg\" alt=\"essential kpi tracker template in excel that tracks measurement frequency and grades performance by green, yellow, and red\" width=\"690\" style=\"width: 690px;\"></p> \n<p>If you're a fan of the monthly metrics template -- item #10 on this list -- you might want to grab a copy of this template as well. The essential KPI tracker, shown above, takes the metrics your marketing team has agreed to track and describes them in more detail.</p> \n<p>KPI stands for \"key performance indicator\" -- they're basically your <em>most important</em> metrics, each with a unique purpose and place in your marketing strategy. Using this template, you can assign specific employees to each KPI, define the frequency at which you'll monitor each KPI's performance, and assign each KPI a color that reflects the quality of that KPI's performance.</p> \n<p>If one of your KPIs is organic traffic, for example, you can set up your template such that 100 page views per month is red (poor performance), 500 page views/month is yellow (stable performance), and 1000 page views/month is green (great performance).</p> \n<p>Data is any marketer's friend, and even though spreadsheets seem like they've been around forever, Microsoft Excel has so many capabilities that still make it an amazing resource for displaying, organizing, analyzing, and parsing data. With a little bit of Excel magic, you can streamline your workflow and/or arrive at some a-ha moments from data insights.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in March 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p>  \n<img \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 16 Jul 2020 18:45:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/excel-marketing-templates.jpg#keepProtocol","linkMd5":"615cf467472f16725c45b96d745e0fc9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn29@2020_5/2020-07-30/1596118305250_8735ec1d362e9801.webp","metaImg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/excel-marketing-templates.jpg#keepProtocol","author":"cstec@hubspot.com
